alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:23PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Albany County through 615 PM MDT... At 522 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Wheatland Reservoir 3, or 33 miles west of Wheatland, moving south at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Albany County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; South Laramie Range
